00048         template <class S>
00049         bool checkIdExists( const string& id,const map<string,S>& container, const string& operation, int sock, bool printDebug = DO_DEBUG )
00050         {
00051             logger.print( "Notify: entered CommandHandler::checkIdExists", this->doNotify && printDebug );
00052             //the weakest locking available for the data structure
00053             this->readWriteLock.readLock();
00054             if( container.find( id ) == container.end() )
00055             {
00056                 this->readWriteLock.unlock();
00057                 string warning = "Warning: tried to use: " + operation + " on an object with " + id + " that does not exist, try creating it first";
00058                 this->socketMethods.write( sock, warning, printDebug ); 
00059                 logger.print( warning, printDebug );
00060                 return false;
00061             }
00062             this->readWriteLock.unlock();
00063             return true;
00064     
00065         }
00066         template <class T>
00067         bool checkIdDoesNotExist( const string& id, const map<string,T>& container, const string& operation, int sock, bool printDebug = DO_DEBUG )
00068         {
00069             logger.print( "Notify: entered SystemCommandHandler::checkSystemDoesNotExist", this->doNotify && printDebug );
00070             //the weakest locking available for the data structure
00071             this->readWriteLock.readLock();
00072             if( container.find( id ) != container.end() )
00073             {
00074                 this->readWriteLock.unlock();
00075                 string warning = "Warning: can't " + operation + " since a system with that id: " + id + " already exists";
00076                 this->socketMethods.write( sock, warning, printDebug ); 
00077                 logger.print( warning, printDebug );
00078                 return false;
00079             }
00080             this->readWriteLock.unlock();
00081             return true;
00082         }
00083         template <class K, class V>
00084         LOCAL bool getMap( map<K,V>& Map, const string& request, int sock, bool printDebug = DO_DEBUG )
00085         {
00086             this->logger.print( "Notify: entered CommandHandler::getMap", this->doNotify && printDebug );
00087             //we check this mainly in case a SIGPIPE happened..
00088             //(So we don't keep writing, a hopefully, neither does the caller)
00089             if( !this->socketMethods.write( sock, request, printDebug ) )
00090             {
00091                 this->logger.print( "Error: in CommandHandler::getMap, write failed" );
00092                 return false;
00093             }
00094             string reply = "";
00095             this->socketMethods.recieve( sock, reply, printDebug );
00096             bool success = false;
00097             Map = Utility::parseMap<K,V>( reply, success, printDebug ); 
00098             if( !success )
00099             {
00100                 string error = "Warning: in CommandHandler::getMap: " + request +  
00101                             " requires a map in the default form generated by Utility::mapToString, " 
00102                             + reply + " was not in this form.";
00103                 logger.print( error, printDebug );
00104                 this->socketMethods.write( sock, error, printDebug );
00105                 return false;
00106             }
00107     
00108             return true;   
00109         }
00110         template <class U>
00111         LOCAL bool getBasicType( U& t, const string& request, int sock, bool printDebug = DO_DEBUG )
00112         {
00113             this->logger.print( "Notify: entered CommandHandler::getBasicType", this->doNotify && printDebug );
00114             //we check this mainly in case a SIGPIPE happened..
00115             //(So we don't keep writing, and hopefully, neither does the caller)
00116             if( !this->socketMethods.write( sock, request, printDebug ) )
00117             {
00118                 this->logger.print( "Error: in CommandHandler::getMap, write failed" );
00119                 return false;
00120             }
00121             string reply = "";
00122             this->socketMethods.recieve( sock, reply, printDebug );
00123             bool success = false;
00124             t = Utility::stringTo<U>( reply, success, printDebug );
00125             if( !success )
00126             {
00127                 string error = "Warning: in CommandHandler::getBasicType: " + request +  
00128                             " requires a type id typeid of: "  
00129                             + lexical_cast<string>( typeid( U ).name() )+ " but the reply was: " + reply ;
00130                 logger.print( error, printDebug );
00131                 this->socketMethods.write( sock, error, printDebug );
00132                 return false;
00133             }
00134             return true;
00135         }

00155         LOCAL bool unlock( const string& id, bool printDebug );
